intro: Eriorhaphe phoenicea, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Eriorhaphe phoenicea is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
